A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Luke's character was utterly destroyed and then his life was thrown away.
Snoke: We hardly knew ya and see ya later!
Rey and Kylo... meh.
Finn's character did nothing that mattered.
Rose's character did nothing that mattered.
Leia's character was unconscious for most of the movie.
Phasma's character does almost nothing.
I think the cute little whatever-they-were creatures got more screen time than Phasma\, however they too were pointless.
The side trip to Space Vegas was almost meaningless.
The retcon of fuel was offensive and destroys the past of the milieu.
The invention of hyperspace tracking destroys the future of the milieu.
The invention of the tactic of hyperspace ramming destroys the future of the milieu\, not to mention begging the question of why not one person has ever tried this in the last several thousand years (because if they had\, it would not be a standard tactic since it's so obviously effective)\, further beginning the question about why it was **shown** differently in Rogue One.
I can't give this movie less than 1 star\, it appears.  I think I should be able to give is zero start\, but hey\, that's just me.
